sentences.english: But do these figures reflect the real income situation of Chinese people?
sentences.chinese: 但這些數據是否反映了中國人民的真實情況呢？

sentences.english: The one eyed Wang Huaie directs the truth of how he framed and disc for Jing kui.
sentences.chinese: 獨眼龍將王懷鍔指使他如何陷害景逵的實情和盤供出。

sentences.english: So I told them the truth, albeit somewhat abridged.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我告訴了她們實情，儘管有所刪節。

sentences.english: In the meantime, however, the practice will continue.
sentences.chinese: 然而，與此同時，現實情況還在繼續。

sentences.english: Mr Walendowski said he would tell police "the truth, " according to the complaint.
sentences.chinese: 根據控告書，沃倫鬥斯基先生說他願意告知警察實情。

sentences.english: And he tells me the truth.

sentences.chinese: 他講的是確鑿不移的實情。

sentences.english: That may be the dream but, as Chan notes, the reality is often different.
sentences.chinese: 這可能是個夢想，但據陳說，現實情況通常都很困難。

sentences.english: Her description of what happened approximated to the truth.
sentences.chinese: 她敘述所發生的事情近於實情。

sentences.english: Ultimately we found there was much truth in what he was presenting.
sentences.chinese: 在他展示的證據中核查人員還能找出更多的實情。

sentences.english: Bodhisattva Lingji heard about this and gave Monkey a Wind-Fixing Pill.
sentences.chinese: 靈吉菩薩得知實情，給他一粒“定風丹”再去借扇。

sentences.english: So the percentages don't tell you the reality.
sentences.chinese: 所以百分比並不能說明現實情況。

sentences.english: So here’s more info about my advertising revenue and this whole drama
sentences.chinese: 因此，下面我就寫寫我的廣告收入和這整齣戲的實情。

sentences.english: Build chastity memorial arch to belie the truth of being a bitch.
sentences.chinese: 建一個貞節牌坊以掩蓋她是女表子的實情。

sentences.english: Joe is our monitor, he should tell it like it is.
sentences.chinese: 喬是我們的班長，他會告訴你實情。

sentences.english: They all said that the true facts, Cao Cao cried aphonia, orders funeral Jinshi.
sentences.chinese: 大家說了實情，曹操痛哭失聲，命令厚葬近侍。

definition: to conceal/to hide (a taboo subject)/to cover up the truth
to explain/to illustrate/to indicate/to show/to prove/explanation/directions/caption/CL:個|个[ge4]
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to admit/to concede/to recognize/recognition (diplomatic, artistic etc)/to acknowledge
